intro: Scorzonera odontopleura, commonly known as the toothed scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, toothed leaves and yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its roots are often tuberous, which can be edible in some species, though this is not well-documented for Scorzonera odontopleura. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
